name: NYC Recycles
description: City of New York Curbside Recycling Program
materials: Aluminum Cans; Brown Paper Bags; Cardboard; Catalogs; Clothes Hangers (Metal); Dairy Tubs; Drink Boxes; Food Storage Containers; Large Household Appliances; Magazines; Milk Cartons; Newspapers; Office Paper; Paper (Mixed); Phone books; Plant Trays, Pots & Tags; Plastic #1 (PETE); Plastic #2 (HDPE); Plastic #3 (PVC); Plastic #4 (LDPE); Plastic #5 (Polypropylene); Plastic #6 (Polystyrene); Plastic #7; Plastic Bottle Caps; Scrap Metal; Tin or Steel Cans
notes:
Set out after 4 PM the night before scheduled collection day.   Paper and cardboard must be placed out in bags, receptacles, or bundles.

Place metal, glass, plastic, and cartons in bags or receptacles. Bulky items can be placed next to bags and receptacles.

name: NYC Organics Collection
materials: Brush; Food Scraps; Grass Clippings; Weeds; Yard Waste; Cork; Cut Flowers; Leaves; Compostable Plastic

name: DSNY Collection
materials: Air Conditioners; Dehumidifiers; Large Household Appliances; Refrigerators
notes: Large and small appliances that are mostly metal or rigid plastic can be recycled with your metal, glass, and plastic. Before discarding any refrigerator or freezer, water cooler, dehumidifier, air conditioner, or other type of appliance containing Freon, you must call 311 or request an appointment online for the recovery of CFC and pick-up for recycling by DSNY.

name: re-fashionNYC
materials: Bras; Clothing; Denim; Purses, Handbags, & Totes; Shoes; Textiles
notes: re-fashioNYC is a partnership between the NYC Department of Sanitation and Housing Works to make clothing donation as easy as possible, through a convenient in-building service. Office buildings, businesses, schools, and apartment buildings with over ten units are eligible. Sign up online to enroll your building.
